body_content.explanation: to search in or look at a place again, for a second, third, etc. time, in order to discover more about it:
examples: He wrote an account of returning to re-explore the country he left in the 1970s.
If healing is slow, it may be necessary to reexplore the wound.

body_content.explanation: to think or talk about something again, for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: Collaborating on the project has allowed them to re-explore their friendship.
If we want to remain on this planet, we must reexplore our connection to the plants and animals who share it with us.
I suggest we re-explore and see if there is any scope for improvement.
